revised_title: Reformulation of the Stochastic Corrector Model in Major Transitions in Evolution
tldr: The authors present a mathematical reformulation of the stochastic corrector model, which describes the group selection dynamics of compartmentalized replicators. They apply this model to the major transitions in evolution, such as the origin of protocell genomes and the emergence of metakaryotic cells. The reformulation uses standard branching processes to analyze the full dynamics of the population of compartments, allowing for a more rigorous understanding of related problems.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Evolutionary Biology
